DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study evaluate analgesic efficacy RN624 compare placebo compare naproxen treatment adult patient chronic low back pain .
DOC.brief_title: RN624 In Adult Patients With Chronic Low Back Pain
DOC.criteria: Male female race , > 18 year age BMI ≤39 kg/m2 Present duration chronic low back pain ≥3 month require regular use analgesic medication ( > 4 day per week past month ) Primary location low back pain 12th thoracic vertebra low gluteal fold , without radiation posterior thigh , classify Category 1 2 accord classification Quebec Task Force Spinal Disorders Must score ≥4 Low Back Pain Intensity ( NRS ) current treatment Screening , complete least 4 daily pain diary 5 day prior Randomization , average Low Back Pain Intensity ( NRS ) score ≥4 Back pain due visceral disorder ( i.e . endometriosis ) Back pain due recent major trauma ( i.e . vertebral fracture , posttraumatic spondylolisthesis ) History lumbosacral radiculopathy , spinal stenosis associate neurological impairment , neurogenic claudication Osteoporotic compression fracture within last 6 month Known history : Rheumatoid arthritis ; Seronegative spondyloarthropathy ( i.e. , ankylose spondylitis , psoriatic arthritis , reactive arthritis , inflammatory bowel diseaserelated arthropathy ) ; Paget 's disease spine , pelvis femur ; Fibromyalgia ; Tumors infection spinal cord Patients receive acetaminophen manage chronic low back pain Any uncontrolled untreated chronic disease
